entities.name: God
entities.description: The divine being who created the heavens and the earth, and interacts with humanity throughout the narrative.

entities.name: heavens
entities.description: The celestial sphere, created by God, and later referred to as the expanse.

entities.name: earth
entities.description: The planet, initially without form and void, later separated into dry land and seas.

entities.name: Spirit of God
entities.description: The divine presence hovering over the waters in the beginning.

entities.name: light
entities.description: The first element created by God, separated from darkness to form Day.

entities.name: darkness
entities.description: The absence of light, separated from light to form Night.

entities.name: Day
entities.description: The period of light, named by God.

entities.name: Night
entities.description: The period of darkness, named by God.

entities.name: expanse
entities.description: The firmament created by God to separate the waters, later called Heaven.

entities.name: waters
entities.description: The primordial waters, later separated into waters above and below the expanse, and gathered to form Seas.

entities.name: dry land
entities.description: The land that appeared when the waters were gathered, named Earth by God.

entities.name: Seas
entities.description: The bodies of water gathered together by God.

entities.name: vegetation
entities.description: Plants, including those yielding seed and fruit trees, created on the third day.

entities.name: lights in the expanse
entities.description: Celestial bodies (sun, moon, stars) created to separate day from night and serve as signs, seasons, days, and years.

entities.name: greater light
entities.description: The sun, created to rule the day.

entities.name: lesser light
entities.description: The moon, created to rule the night.

entities.name: stars
entities.description: Celestial bodies created by God.

entities.name: living creatures
entities.description: Animals created by God, including sea creatures, birds, livestock, creeping things, and beasts of the earth.

entities.name: man
entities.description: Humanity, created in God's image, male and female.

entities.name: breath of life
entities.description: The vital essence breathed into man by the Lord God, making him a living creature.

entities.name: garden in Eden
entities.description: A specific garden planted by the Lord God in the east of Eden.

entities.name: Eden
entities.description: A region where God planted a garden.

entities.name: tree of life
entities.description: A tree in the Garden of Eden, eating from which would grant eternal life.

entities.name: tree of the knowledge of good and evil
entities.description: A tree in the Garden of Eden, from which man was forbidden to eat.

entities.name: Pishon
entities.description: One of the four rivers flowing out of Eden, flowing around the land of Havilah.

entities.name: Havilah
entities.description: A land rich in gold, bdellium, and onyx stone, flowed around by the Pishon river.

entities.name: Gihon
entities.description: One of the four rivers flowing out of Eden, flowing around the land of Cush.

entities.name: Cush
entities.description: A land flowed around by the Gihon river, also a son of Ham.

entities.name: Tigris
entities.description: One of the four rivers flowing out of Eden, flowing east of Assyria.

entities.name: Assyria
entities.description: A region east of which the Tigris river flows.

entities.name: Euphrates
entities.description: One of the four rivers flowing out of Eden, also a boundary of the land promised to Abram.

entities.name: Adam
entities.description: The first man, formed by the Lord God from dust, and later named his wife Eve.

entities.name: woman
entities.description: The first woman, created from Adam's rib, later named Eve.

entities.name: serpent
entities.description: A crafty beast that deceived the woman in the Garden of Eden.

entities.name: Eve
entities.description: The first woman, named by Adam because she was the mother of all living.

entities.name: cherubim
entities.description: Angel-like beings placed at the east of the Garden of Eden to guard the way to the tree of life.

entities.name: flaming sword
entities.description: A sword that turned every way, used by the cherubim to guard the Garden of Eden.

entities.name: Cain
entities.description: The first son of Adam and Eve, a worker of the ground, who killed his brother Abel.

entities.name: Abel
entities.description: The second son of Adam and Eve, a keeper of sheep, whose offering was favored by the Lord over Cain's.

entities.name: Nod
entities.description: The land east of Eden where Cain settled after being cursed by the Lord.

entities.name: Enoch
entities.description: Son of Cain, after whom Cain named the city he built; also a son of Jared who walked with God.

entities.name: Lamech
entities.description: A descendant of Cain, known for taking two wives and boasting of revenge; also a descendant of Seth and father of Noah.

entities.name: Adah
entities.description: One of Lamech's wives, mother of Jabal and Jubal.

entities.name: Zillah
entities.description: One of Lamech's wives, mother of Tubal-cain and Naamah.

entities.name: Jabal
entities.description: Son of Adah, identified as the father of those who dwell in tents and have livestock.

entities.name: Jubal
entities.description: Son of Adah, identified as the father of all those who play the lyre and pipe.

entities.name: Tubal-cain
entities.description: Son of Zillah, identified as the forger of all instruments of bronze and iron.

entities.name: Naamah
entities.description: Daughter of Zillah, sister of Tubal-cain.

entities.name: Seth
entities.description: Son of Adam and Eve, born after Abel's death, appointed as another offspring.

entities.name: Enosh
entities.description: Son of Seth, during whose time people began to call upon the name of the Lord.

entities.name: Kenan
entities.description: Son of Enosh.

entities.name: Mahalalel
entities.description: Son of Kenan.

entities.name: Jared
entities.description: Son of Mahalalel, father of Enoch.

entities.name: Methuselah
entities.description: Son of Enoch, known for living the longest.

entities.name: Noah
entities.description: Son of Lamech, a righteous man chosen by God to build the ark and survive the flood.

entities.name: Shem
entities.description: One of Noah's three sons, an ancestor of Abram.

entities.name: Ham
entities.description: One of Noah's three sons, father of Canaan.

entities.name: Japheth
entities.description: One of Noah's three sons.

entities.name: sons of God
entities.description: Beings who took daughters of man as wives before the flood.

entities.name: Nephilim
entities.description: Mighty men of renown on the earth in the days before the flood.

entities.name: ark
entities.description: A large vessel built by Noah at God's command to save his family and animals from the flood.

entities.name: flood of waters
entities.description: A great deluge sent by God to destroy all flesh on earth due to its wickedness.

entities.name: covenant
entities.description: An agreement or promise made by God, notably with Noah after the flood and with Abram/Abraham.

entities.name: forty days and forty nights
entities.description: The duration of the rain during the great flood.

entities.name: mountains of Ararat
entities.description: The location where Noah's ark came to rest after the flood.

entities.name: raven
entities.description: A bird sent out by Noah from the ark to check if the waters had dried.

entities.name: dove
entities.description: A bird sent out by Noah from the ark, which returned with an olive leaf, indicating receding waters.

entities.name: olive leaf
entities.description: A freshly plucked leaf brought back by the dove, signaling that the waters had subsided.

entities.name: rainbow
entities.description: A sign of God's covenant with Noah and all living creatures, promising never to destroy the earth by flood again.

entities.name: Canaan
entities.description: Son of Ham, cursed by Noah.

entities.name: Nimrod
entities.description: Son of Cush, a mighty hunter and the first to establish a kingdom on earth.

entities.name: Babel
entities.description: A city in the land of Shinar, part of Nimrod's kingdom, where God confused the languages.

entities.name: Shinar
entities.description: A land where Nimrod's kingdom began and where the Tower of Babel was built.

entities.name: Nineveh
entities.description: A city built by Nimrod in Assyria.

entities.name: Philistines
entities.description: A group of people descended from Casluhim, mentioned in relation to Gerar.

entities.name: Canaanites
entities.description: Various groups of people inhabiting the land of Canaan, including Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites, Hivites, Arkites, Sinites, Arvadites, Zemarites, and Hamathites.

entities.name: Sodom
entities.description: A city in the Jordan Valley, known for its wickedness, later destroyed by God.

entities.name: Gomorrah
entities.description: A city in the Jordan Valley, known for its wickedness, later destroyed by God.

entities.name: Tower of Babel
entities.description: A tower built by the children of man to reach the heavens, leading God to confuse their language and disperse them.

entities.name: Abram
entities.description: Initially named Abram, later renamed Abraham by God, the patriarch chosen to be the father of a great nation.

entities.name: Haran
entities.description: A city where Terah, Abram, and Lot settled on their way to Canaan; also a son of Terah.

entities.name: Ur of the Chaldeans
entities.description: The original homeland of Terah, Abram, and Lot.

entities.name: Sarai
entities.description: Initially named Sarai, later renamed Sarah by God, Abram's wife.

entities.name: Lot
entities.description: Abram's nephew, who separated from Abram and settled in the Jordan Valley near Sodom.

entities.name: land of Canaan
entities.description: The land promised by God to Abram and his offspring.

entities.name: Egypt
entities.description: A country where Abram sojourned during a famine, and later where Joseph became governor.

entities.name: Pharaoh
entities.description: The king of Egypt, who interacted with Abram and later with Joseph.

entities.name: Jordan Valley
entities.description: A well-watered region chosen by Lot for his settlement.

entities.name: Hebron
entities.description: A city in Canaan where Abram settled by the oaks of Mamre, and where Sarah was buried.

entities.name: Amraphel
entities.description: King of Shinar, one of the four kings who made war in the Valley of Siddim.

entities.name: Chedorlaomer
entities.description: King of Elam, the dominant king among the four who fought against the five kings of the valley.

entities.name: Valley of Siddim
entities.description: The location of a battle between kings, later identified with the Salt Sea (Dead Sea).

entities.name: Melchizedek
entities.description: King of Salem and priest of God Most High, who blessed Abram after his victory.

entities.name: Salem
entities.description: The city ruled by Melchizedek, often identified with Jerusalem.

entities.name: Eliezer of Damascus
entities.description: Abram's chief servant, initially considered his heir.

entities.name: Hagar
entities.description: Sarai's Egyptian servant, who bore Ishmael to Abram.

entities.name: Ishmael
entities.description: Son of Abram and Hagar, whose descendants would become a great nation.

entities.name: Beer-lahai-roi
entities.description: A well in the wilderness where the angel of the Lord found Hagar.

entities.name: Abraham
entities.description: The new name given to Abram by God, signifying his role as the father of a multitude of nations.

entities.name: Sarah
entities.description: The new name given to Sarai by God, signifying her role as mother of nations and kings.

entities.name: Isaac
entities.description: Son of Abraham and Sarah, born in their old age, through whom God's covenant would be established.

entities.name: circumcision
entities.description: A ritual practice commanded by God to Abraham as a sign of the covenant.

entities.name: Sodom and Gomorrah's destruction
entities.description: The overthrow of the wicked cities of Sodom and Gomorrah by sulfur and fire from the Lord.

entities.name: Lot's wife
entities.description: Turned into a pillar of salt for looking back during the destruction of Sodom.

entities.name: Zoar
entities.description: A small city spared from destruction at Lot's request, where he initially fled.

entities.name: Moab
entities.description: Son of Lot's firstborn daughter, ancestor of the Moabites.

entities.name: Ben-ammi
entities.description: Son of Lot's younger daughter, ancestor of the Ammonites.

entities.name: Abimelech
entities.description: King of Gerar, who took Sarah (thinking she was Abraham's sister) and later Rebekah (thinking she was Isaac's sister).

entities.name: Gerar
entities.description: A city where Abraham and Isaac sojourned, ruled by Abimelech.

entities.name: Beersheba
entities.description: A place where Abraham and Abimelech made a covenant, and where Isaac later settled and built an altar.

entities.name: land of Moriah
entities.description: The mountainous region where God commanded Abraham to offer Isaac as a burnt offering.

entities.name: Rebekah
entities.description: Daughter of Bethuel, wife of Isaac, and mother of Esau and Jacob.

entities.name: Bethuel
entities.description: Son of Nahor, father of Rebekah and Laban.

entities.name: Laban
entities.description: Son of Bethuel, brother of Rebekah, and father of Leah and Rachel, who employed Jacob for many years.

entities.name: Esau
entities.description: The firstborn son of Isaac and Rebekah, a skillful hunter, also called Edom.

entities.name: Jacob
entities.description: The younger son of Isaac and Rebekah, who acquired Esau's birthright and blessing, later renamed Israel.

entities.name: Edom
entities.description: The land where Esau and his descendants settled, also another name for Esau.

entities.name: birthright
entities.description: The privilege of the firstborn son, sold by Esau to Jacob for a meal.

entities.name: blessing
entities.description: A divine favor or pronouncement, obtained by Jacob from Isaac through deception.

entities.name: Paddan-aram
entities.description: The region where Laban lived, and where Jacob went to find a wife.

entities.name: Bethel
entities.description: A place initially called Luz, where Jacob had a dream of a ladder to heaven and made a vow to God.

entities.name: ladder to heaven
entities.description: A vision seen by Jacob at Bethel, with angels ascending and descending on it.

entities.name: Leah
entities.description: Laban's older daughter, Jacob's first wife, and mother of Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun, and Dinah.

entities.name: Rachel
entities.description: Laban's younger daughter, Jacob's beloved wife, and mother of Joseph and Benjamin.

entities.name: Bilhah
entities.description: Rachel's servant, who bore Dan and Naphtali to Jacob.

entities.name: Zilpah
entities.description: Leah's servant, who bore Gad and Asher to Jacob.

entities.name: Reuben
entities.description: Jacob's firstborn son by Leah.

entities.name: Simeon
entities.description: Jacob's second son by Leah, who, with Levi, avenged Dinah.

entities.name: Levi
entities.description: Jacob's third son by Leah, who, with Simeon, avenged Dinah.

entities.name: Judah
entities.description: Jacob's fourth son by Leah, from whom the royal line would descend.

entities.name: Issachar
entities.description: Jacob's son by Leah.

entities.name: Zebulun
entities.description: Jacob's son by Leah.

entities.name: Dan
entities.description: Jacob's son by Bilhah.

entities.name: Naphtali
entities.description: Jacob's son by Bilhah.

entities.name: Gad
entities.description: Jacob's son by Zilpah.

entities.name: Asher
entities.description: Jacob's son by Zilpah.

entities.name: Dinah
entities.description: Jacob's daughter by Leah, who was defiled by Shechem.

entities.name: Joseph
entities.description: Jacob's son by Rachel, beloved by his father, sold into slavery, and later became governor of Egypt.

entities.name: Benjamin
entities.description: Jacob's youngest son by Rachel, born as Rachel died.

entities.name: household gods
entities.description: Idols stolen by Rachel from her father Laban.

entities.name: Gilead
entities.description: A hill country where Jacob and Laban made a covenant heap of stones.

entities.name: Israel
entities.description: The new name given to Jacob after wrestling with God, meaning 'he strives with God'.

entities.name: Peniel
entities.description: The place where Jacob wrestled with God and saw God face to face, meaning 'face of God'.

entities.name: Shechem
entities.description: A city in Canaan where Jacob bought land and where Dinah was defiled.

entities.name: Hamor
entities.description: The Hivite prince of the land of Shechem, father of Shechem.

entities.name: Shechem (person)
entities.description: Son of Hamor, who defiled Dinah and was later killed by Simeon and Levi.

entities.name: Edomites
entities.description: The descendants of Esau, who settled in the hill country of Seir.

entities.name: Potiphar
entities.description: An officer of Pharaoh and captain of the guard, who bought Joseph as a slave.

entities.name: Pharaoh's cupbearer
entities.description: A royal official imprisoned with Joseph, whose dream Joseph interpreted favorably.

entities.name: Pharaoh's baker
entities.description: A royal official imprisoned with Joseph, whose dream Joseph interpreted unfavorably.

entities.name: Nile
entities.description: The river in Egypt, central to Pharaoh's dreams of cows and grain.

entities.name: seven years of plenty
entities.description: A period of abundant harvests in Egypt, foretold by Joseph's interpretation of Pharaoh's dreams.

entities.name: seven years of famine
entities.description: A period of severe food scarcity in Egypt and surrounding lands, foretold by Joseph.

entities.name: Zaphenath-paneah
entities.description: The Egyptian name given to Joseph by Pharaoh.

entities.name: Asenath
entities.description: Daughter of Potiphera, priest of On, and wife of Joseph.

entities.name: Manasseh
entities.description: Joseph's firstborn son.

entities.name: Ephraim
entities.description: Joseph's second son.

entities.name: Goshen
entities.description: A fertile region in Egypt where Joseph settled his father and brothers.

entities.name: silver cup
entities.description: Joseph's personal cup, placed in Benjamin's sack to test his brothers.

entities.name: twelve tribes of Israel
entities.description: The collective descendants of Jacob's twelve sons.

entities.name: cave of Machpelah
entities.description: A burial cave in Canaan, purchased by Abraham, where Abraham, Sarah, Isaac, Rebekah, Leah, and Jacob were buried.

relationships.description: God created the heavens.
God created the earth.
The Spirit of God was hovering over the waters.
God created light.
God separated the light from the darkness.
God separated the darkness from the light.
God named the light Day.
God named the darkness Night.
God created the expanse.
The expanse separated the waters from the waters.
God named the expanse Heaven (heavens).
God caused the dry land to appear.
God named the dry land Earth.
God named the gathered waters Seas.
God created vegetation.
Vegetation was on the earth.
God created lights in the expanse.
God created the greater light.
God created the lesser light.
God created the stars.
The greater light rules the Day.
The lesser light rules the Night.
God set the lights in the expanse of the heavens.
The lights in the expanse provide light to the earth.
God created living creatures.
Sea creatures (living creatures) swarm in the waters.
Birds (living creatures) fly above the earth.
God created man in his own image.
God formed man from the ground (earth).
God breathed the breath of life into man.
God planted a garden in Eden.
God placed Adam in the garden in Eden.
The tree of life was in the garden in Eden.

relationships.source: tree of the knowledge of good and evil
relationships.description: The tree of the knowledge of good and evil was in the garden in Eden.
The Pishon river flowed around the land of Havilah.
The Gihon river flowed around the land of Cush.
The Tigris river flows east of Assyria.

relationships.target: tree of the knowledge of good and evil
relationships.description: God forbade Adam from eating from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
God created woman from Adam's rib.
Adam named the woman.
God created the serpent.
The serpent deceived the woman.

relationships.target: tree of the knowledge of good and evil
relationships.description: The woman ate from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
The woman gave fruit from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil to Adam.

relationships.target: tree of the knowledge of good and evil
relationships.description: Adam ate from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
Adam named his wife Eve.
Eve was the mother of all living.
God clothed Adam.
God clothed Eve.
God drove Adam out from the garden of Eden.
God placed cherubim at the east of the garden of Eden.
God placed a flaming sword at the east of the garden of Eden.
Cherubim guarded the way to the tree of life.
A flaming sword guarded the way to the tree of life.
Adam was the husband of Eve.
Eve bore Cain.
Adam was the father of Cain.
Eve bore Abel.
Adam was the father of Abel.
Cain was the brother of Abel.
Cain killed Abel.
Cain settled in the land of Nod.
Nod was located east of Eden.
Cain fathered Enoch.
Enoch fathered Irad.
Irad fathered Mehujael.
Mehujael fathered Methushael.
Methushael fathered Lamech.
Adah was one of Lamech's wives.
Zillah was one of Lamech's wives.
Adah bore Jabal.
Lamech was the father of Jabal.
Jabal was the brother of Jubal.
Adah bore Jubal.
Lamech was the father of Jubal.
Zillah bore Tubal-cain.
Lamech was the father of Tubal-cain.
Naamah was the sister of Tubal-cain.
Zillah bore Naamah.
Lamech was the father of Naamah.
Adam fathered Seth.
Eve bore Seth.
Seth was the brother of Cain.
Seth was the brother of Abel.
Seth fathered Enosh.
Enosh fathered Kenan.
Kenan fathered Mahalalel.
Mahalalel fathered Jared.
Jared fathered Enoch.
Enoch fathered Methuselah.
Methuselah fathered Lamech.
Lamech fathered Noah.
Noah fathered Shem.
Noah fathered Ham.
Noah fathered Japheth.
The sons of God took daughters of man as wives.
The sons of God fathered Nephilim with daughters of man.
Daughters of man bore Nephilim to the sons of God.
The Nephilim were on the earth.
God commanded Noah to build the ark.
God caused a flood of waters upon the earth.
The flood of waters destroyed all living creatures on earth.
God made a covenant with Noah.
Noah entered the ark.
Shem entered the ark with Noah.
Ham entered the ark with Noah.
Japheth entered the ark with Noah.
Noah brought living creatures into the ark.
The flood of waters came upon the earth.
The flood of waters lasted forty days and forty nights.
The ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.
Noah sent a raven from the ark.
Noah sent a dove from the ark.
The dove returned with an olive leaf.
The waters receded from the earth.
God blessed Noah.
God blessed Shem.
God blessed Ham.
God blessed Japheth.
God established a covenant with Noah and all living creatures.
God placed the rainbow in the cloud.
The rainbow is a sign of the covenant.
Ham was the father of Canaan.
Ham was the brother of Shem.
Ham was the brother of Japheth.
Shem was a son of Noah.
Ham was a son of Noah.
Japheth was a son of Noah.
Noah cursed Canaan.
Cush was a son of Ham.
Canaan was a son of Ham.
Havilah is listed as a son of Cush (referring to a region/people).
Cush fathered Nimrod.
Nimrod established his kingdom in the land of Shinar.
Babel was part of Nimrod's kingdom.
Nimrod built Nineveh in Assyria.
The Philistines descended from Casluhim.
Canaan fathered various groups of Canaanites.
The territory of the Canaanites extended to Gerar.
The territory of the Canaanites extended to Sodom.
The territory of the Canaanites extended to Gomorrah.
Arpachshad was a son of Shem.
Arpachshad fathered Shelah.
Shelah fathered Eber.
The children of man built the Tower of Babel.
God confused the language at Babel.
Nahor fathered Terah.
Terah fathered Abram.
Terah fathered Nahor.
Terah fathered Haran.
Haran fathered Lot.
Haran died in Ur of the Chaldeans.
Sarai was Abram's wife.
Milcah was Nahor's wife.
Haran was the father of Milcah.
Terah departed from Ur of the Chaldeans.
Abram departed from Ur of the Chaldeans.
Lot departed from Ur of the Chaldeans.
Sarai departed from Ur of the Chaldeans.
Terah settled in Haran.
Abram settled in Haran.
Lot settled in Haran.
Sarai settled in Haran.
God commanded Abram to go to the land of Canaan.
Abram departed from Haran.
Lot traveled with Abram.
Abram traveled to the land of Canaan.
Sarai traveled to the land of Canaan.
Lot traveled to the land of Canaan.
Abram arrived in the land of Canaan.
The Canaanites inhabited the land of Canaan.
Abram traveled to Egypt due to famine.
A famine was in the land of Canaan.
Pharaoh took Sarai into his house.
God afflicted Pharaoh because of Sarai.
Pharaoh spoke to Abram about Sarai.
Pharaoh sent Abram away from Egypt.
Pharaoh sent Sarai away from Egypt.
Abram departed from Egypt.
Lot separated from Abram.
Lot chose the Jordan Valley.
Lot settled in Sodom.
Abram settled in the land of Canaan.
Sodom was inhabited by wicked men.
God promised the land of Canaan to Abram.
Abram settled in Hebron.
Hebron was located at the oaks of Mamre.
Amraphel was king of Shinar.
Chedorlaomer was king of Elam.
Amraphel fought against Sodom.
Chedorlaomer fought against Sodom.
Amraphel fought against Gomorrah.
Chedorlaomer fought against Gomorrah.
Amraphel fought against Zoar.
Chedorlaomer fought against Zoar.
The Valley of Siddim is identified as the Salt Sea (Dead Sea).
Lot was captured by Chedorlaomer and his allies.
Abram rescued Lot.
Melchizedek was king of Salem.
Melchizedek was a priest of God Most High.
Melchizedek blessed Abram.
Abram gave a tenth of everything to Melchizedek.
Eliezer of Damascus was initially considered Abram's heir.
God made a covenant with Abram.
God promised the land of Canaan to Abram's offspring.
The Euphrates is a great river.
Various Canaanite groups inhabited the land of Canaan.
Hagar was Sarai's Egyptian servant.
Sarai gave Hagar to Abram as a wife.
Abram took Hagar as a wife.
Hagar conceived a son by Abram.
The angel of the Lord found Hagar.
Hagar bore Ishmael.
The angel of the Lord named Ishmael.
Beer-lahai-roi lies between Kadesh and Bered.
Abram was the father of Ishmael.
Abram named Ishmael.
God appeared to Abram.
God renamed Abram to Abraham.
God promised the land of Canaan to Abraham and his offspring.
Circumcision is a sign of the covenant.
God commanded Abraham to practice circumcision.
God renamed Sarai to Sarah.
God blessed Sarah.
God promised Isaac to Abraham and Sarah.
Sarah would bear Isaac.
Abraham would be the father of Isaac.
God named the son Isaac.
God established his covenant with Isaac.
God blessed Ishmael.
Abraham circumcised Ishmael.
Abraham underwent circumcision.
Ishmael underwent circumcision.
God intended to destroy Sodom.
God intended to destroy Gomorrah.
Abraham interceded for Sodom.
Abraham interceded for Gomorrah.
Two angels arrived in Sodom.
Lot was sitting in the gate of Sodom.
God destroyed Sodom.
God destroyed Gomorrah.
Lot's wife was transformed into a pillar of salt.
